messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### minimumDeletions 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(nums: List[int]) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    mi = mx = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    for i, num in enumerate(nums):   # --- py stmt 4
        if num < nums[mi]:   # --- py stmt 5
            mi = i   # --- py stmt 6
        if num > nums[mx]:   # --- py stmt 7
            mx = i   # --- py stmt 8
    if mi > mx:   # --- py stmt 9
        mi, mx = mx, mi   # --- py stmt 10
    return min(mx + 1, len(nums) - mi, mi + 1 + len(nums) - mx)   # --- py stmt 11
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
// function to find the minimum number of moves required to make all elements equal
function f_gold(nums) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var mx = 0, mi = 0;   // --- py stmt 3
    // loop through the array to find the index of the minimum and maximum elements
    for (var i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {   // --- py stmt 4
        if (nums[i] < nums[mi]) {   // --- py stmt 5
            mi = i;   // --- py stmt 6
        }
        if (nums[i] > nums[mx]) {   // --- py stmt 7
            mx = i;   // --- py stmt 8
        }
    }
    // swap the indices if the minimum index is greater than the maximum index
    if (mi > mx) {   // --- py stmt 9
        [mi, mx] = [mx, mi];   // --- py stmt 10
        // 
    }
    // return the minimum number of moves required to make all elements equal
    return Math.min(mx + 1, nums.length - mi, mi + 1 + nums.length - mx);   // --- py stmt 11
}
```
